direction.raw_text: ... Page nothing... In the distance, a figure approaches out of the darkness, the darkness of Guido's imagination. An escape from his tortured reality. The figure emerges gradually, like a goddess. She is gorgeous, imposing, and seductive. She is CLAUDIA, his film star, his muse. When Claudia reaches Guido, she stops in front of him, takes his hands from his face, and kisses him. And with that gesture, the music swells, the lighting grid rises majestically into the air, the gritty soundstage transforms into something beautiful, transforms into the interior world of GUIDO'S FANTASY. As Claudia moves away, more and more women slowly appear. They emerge from everywhere. These are the women from Guido's life, past and present. Women from his films, women he has loved, the sources of his inspiration and creative genius. A grand OVERTURE unfolds. The most significant women in Guido's life are revealed, each with their own powerful entrance: LUISA, his wife CARLA, his mistress LILLI, his costume designer and accomplice GUIDO'S MAMMA, her spirit STEPHANIE, a fashion journalist SARAGHINA, a whore p. 3 A dark and glamourous dream. The women surround Guido and he loses himself and his anxiety in their collective embrace. INT. STAGE 5, CINECITTA - DAY The fantasy ends abruptly with A VIOLENT GRATING NOISE, as the studio's truck doors are yanked open, jolting Guido who is slumped in the crane seat. Harsh daylight penetrates the gloom. Too bright. He blinks, discombobulated, as a group of silhouetted figures approach with purpose. One of the figures is a well- fed, amiable character, DANTE. He is Guido's longtime associate and Producer. A younger, more ascetic figure accompanies him, sharp and birdlike. This is FAUSTO, an accountant. Dante speaks quickly and without obvious punctuation:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (walking) Guido! You're here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buongiorno, Dante.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been looking for you all over the place. The set's coming along. How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bene, grazie, bene. Guido stands to greet him. They kiss on both cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bene. My God, you look terrible, better go to makeup, forget you've got a press conference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (discreetly, to Dante) He has no tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, makeup and wardrobe. He takes Guido's arm and they head towards daylight. Guido looks back at Fausto, who follows and with a look and a gesture asks Dante who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping Dante) Signor Contini, I'm Fausto.     Good morning, Signor Contini. p. 4 DANTE (interrupts) He's counting costs, you know. The Bank wants him here. (to Fausto) Don't speak to him, I speak to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I have some questions for Signor Contini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all have questions for Signor Contini. They head outside. EXT. CINECITTA - DAY Guido, Dante and Fausto hurry through the studio en route to the Production Offices. Behind them is a large poster of CLAUDIA, starring in Guido's last movie, a failure, LA DONNA MODERNA (The Modern Woman). As Guido passes he causes a mild stir, and many people nod deferentially, offer a Maestro, or Dottore. Guido nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but please, please, I think it's customary for there to be an approved script and budget before filming commences...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he going to follow us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not my intention to be difficult. Maestro, I am a huge admirer of Maestro Contini's movies, your early films are...everybody loves them and... I consider it a great honour for me to be here now... none the less, I need a script and a budget. Neither Dante nor Guido respond. Fausto flounders. They make their way to the Production Offices. Everywhere signs for the movie, ITALIA. INT. PRODUCTION OFFICES, CINECITTA - DAY A long corridor, bustling with activity. The trio heads down it. If a pretty girl goes by, and there are several, both Guido and Dante turn to look but without missing a beat of their solemn conversation. p. 5 As they progress into and through the open plan office, many of the crew look up and cluster around, trying to get Guido's attention, swelling the procession, interjecting with their urgent requests. There are set models everywhere, in the process of being constructed, or painted. JACONELLI, Guido's production designer, looks up from a model, hurries over. Nobody stops moving. As a pretty girl passes between them, they all turn to look. PIERPAOLO, Guido's young PA, has caught up with the procession. He has dozens of phone messages, sorting through them, as he walks alongside Guido, through a partitioned office -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you want your messages?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On my desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no room on your desk. - into the main office -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under my desk. In the trash. Non lo so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (waving them at him) Some of these are urgent!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Pierpaolo) Get me a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confidentially) We will never be ready to shoot in ten days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jaconelli -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (at the same time) Not ready?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continues) Ascolta me. (MORE) p. 6 GUIDO (CONT'D) (he kisses Jaconelli on the cheek) Careful what you say. He's a spy from the bank. Guido carries on moving through the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not exactly from the bank, Guido. Now BENITO, Guido's Casting Director, moves towards Guido, Guido tries to duck away from him as they head towards Guido's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dottore, Dottore. You have actors waiting for you in your office. Auditions all morning. You should see what I've found. I found two sisters. Look, they're right... Guido turns through another partition, as they all besiege him with questions. Benito despairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dottore, this way... Guido heads towards Wardrobe, goes straight through the door, swinging it shut, leaving the chaos behind him. Dante blocks Benito.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maestro!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not now. He's got the Press Conference. INT. WARDROBE, CINECITTA - DAY Guido comes through the door, blows hard from the barrage. They're in Lilli's domain here, and a haven, always, for Guido. Part Edith Head, part Coco Chanel, Lilli is Guido's Costume Designer, no longer young, cranky, indomitable, sharp as a tack. She adores Guido without any sentiment. She's incapable of sentiment. Guido heads straight towards her desk, where she is cutting some fabric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a cigarette. Dante comes in, closing the door behind him. p. 7 DANTE He needs a shirt and tie, Lilli. Guido sits up on Lilli's table, as Dante heads to Lilli's desk and picks up the phone to make a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a coffee and a cigarette. He lies down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unimpressed) Answer a question, I'll give you a coffee. Answer another question, I'll give you a cigarette. And so on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually and an aspirin. Dante stands at Lilli's desk and looks at some drawings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in the background, on the phone) We're running late...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns to Guido and lights a cigarette) Calm down. Directing a movie is a very overrated job, we all know it. You just have to say yes or no. What else do you do? Nothing. Maestro - Should this be Red? Yes. Green? No. More extras? Yes. More lipstick? No. Yes, no, yes, no, yes, no - that's directing. Lilli hands Guido the lit cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right: that's directing. And it doesn't seem to make a blind bit of difference, finally, what the answer is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So please, Guido, yes or no, do you want any costumes in this film?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. p. 8 LILLI You see - simple! (handing him an espresso fetched by her assistant,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Might I know what period the movie's in? Lilli glances at Dante who has edged closer to the table, he looks at the costumes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes. (downs the espresso) Soon. Lilli glares at Dante, ushering him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I don't allow producers in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Two minutes Guido. Lilli is the only person who intimidates Dante. He leaves. Guido pulls out his own tie from his pocket. Lilli walks round and takes the tie off him. Guido sits up. Lilli puts the tie round his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gone. Have you written a word of the script?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you in a panic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She ties Guido's tie for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Luisa going with you to the Press Conference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nobody. Dante.    And his spy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to shave.    You look terrible. p. 9 GUIDO (looking around, desperate) Why is there no fire escape in here? What if somebody needed to escape? I can't face these reporters. I have nothing to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be fine. You're a world class liar, darling, go out there and lie for Italy, lie for Italia. EXT. ROME - DAY Guido is driving his Roadster   through the streets of Rome. An Italian pop song of    the day is playing on the radio as he speeds around the   Piazza del Poppolo. In front of him in the convoy is   Dante with Fausto. INT. GUIDO'S CAR - DAY As Guido drives, he turns to see his MAMMA in the passenger seat. He's not remotely surprised. She appears the way he remembers her. Mamma is extraordinary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's wrong with me? I can't sleep. I can't think. I can't write. I can't breathe. My heart is racing. Am I dying, Mamma? I owe you flowers, I know. I'll come to the cemetery at the weekend. You should have let me bury you in Roma, Mamma, I could visit you every week. Don't look at me like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with kindly patience) Oh, Guido, Guido. He stops at a busy intersection. EXT. STREETS OF ROME / INT. GUIDO'S CAR - DAY This is the Rome of La Dolce Vita, the Rome of Vespas, skinny ties, cool sunglasses, impossibly cool young people. A magnificent fall day, and the cafes are stuffed with the beautiful and chic. p. 10 MAMMA This is your Rome, Guido. The world sees Rome the way you invented it. Your films did that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (buoyed by her encouragement) I miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss you, too. Guido is in his own world. The policeman raps on the bonnet of the car. Guido startles and pulls off, alone in the car. Guido looks across as he drives. Mamma has gone. EXT. HOTEL EXCELSIOR, VIA VENETO - DAY The convoy comes to a quick stop in front of the Hotel Excelsior on the Via Veneto. As soon as Guido gets out of the car, the waiting paparazzi snap his picture. Beautiful women look at him. Guido moves quickly by them. Dante and the team hurry after him.   Fausto tackles Dante. And they hurry after Guido. INT. PRESIDENTIAL SUITE - DAY A big suite. About fifty reporters, men and women, are in the room, and an array of microphones are on a coffee table next to a long couch. Excited chaos. A RADIO REPORTER narrates in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we're just waiting for the arrival of Contini...any moment now - Could this film put the Maestro back on top? A few news cameras are filming.    There's a buffet, and a bartender. And Guido comes into the room, shaking hands, patting shoulders, grabbing a glass of champagne. Dante and the team follow him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here he is..! p. 11 DANTE Silenzio, per favore...Thank you, thank you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dante, Guido Contini's long time producer, is about to speak...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to say a few words from my heart. I am humbled and thrilled to be able to announce that I am producing Guido Contini's next film, Italia, which will star once again Contini's longtime inspiration, the international film star, Claudia Jenssen... A stunning film poster is revealed -- Claudia Jenssen emerging from the Colosseum: CLAUDIA JENSSEN. UN FILM DI GUIDO CONTINI. ITALIA. Flashes. Excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...we start shooting in ten days time in Cinecitta. That makes it one week from Monday. (to Guido, handing over) Thank you, Maestro, thank you very much. This is our ninth film together. Guido Contini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for coming, everybody. Pretending to leave, he heads towards the exit and kisses Dante on the cheek. He returns to the couch. All the reporters fire their questions at once. The questions come on top of each other, and Guido covers his despair with an inflated energy. He takes his sunglasses off and signals to DINARDO, a harsh-looking woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maestro Contini. Maestro Contini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.

direction.raw_text: Grazie. Maestro Contini, your new film is called Italia... big title. Another journalist, Leopardi, vile - sitting next to her, egging Dinardo on - almost sniggers with contempt. p. 12 GUIDO Actually, it's my shortest title yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But hardly a modest one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Films are not modest. They cost too much, they take too long, and they involve too many people. So they should have grand titles.

direction.raw_text: And might you tell the press what the film is about?

direction.raw_text: Of course I can tell you what my film is about...I can tell you the story, I can tell you who I am going to cast, the music I want to use, I can tell you everything... but... I... won't. I'm afraid that if I say anything, the word might get out to the Press. General laughter in the room. He wins a round, but is clearly feeling the strain... Dante recognizes, steps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our next film will be exactly as it sounds. Italia. It's the very spirit of Italy - Italy as myth, Italy as a woman, Italy as a dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds fantastic.    I can't wait to see it. He's still winning. Ignoring the question, he points to STEPHANIE, a gorgeous fashion reporter he recognizes from American Vogue.   Flirtatious and charming, she wants him and he senses it. p. 13 STEPHANIE Signor Contini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephanie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grazie. Could you tell the fashionable women of America who your favorite designer is this year?

direction.raw_text: I'm less interested in the wrapping than what might be inside it.

direction.raw_text: Signor Contini! You're a man of the world, yes? Educated in Britain, a home in Biarritz. With Italia is it fair to say that you've come home for good?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been a long time since you made a movie with your wife, do you plan on casting her in this new film? Guido is spinning plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told Luisa that when we got married I would never again make love to my leading lady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she hasn't worked at all since working with you. Laughter. Everyone starts firing questions at Guido again. Another REPORTER asks a question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why are you being so tight-lipped about this film? It's a serious question. What's the big deal? p. 14 FANTASY: INT. "SOUNDSTAGE" We discover Guido, alone on the soundstage of his unfinished set. A retreat into surreality. He sits on the same couch from the hotel suite. He slouches, arms folded, legs crossed, with his hat pulled over his eyes.
